alert.note: Alert for Carter; Custer; Fallon; Northern Rosebud (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 05 at 2:28PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: .Thunderstorms with very heavy rain will develop over the area with rainfall rates of 1-2 inches an hour possible. Periods of heavy rain over the last couple of days has left a saturated ground that will not be able to absorb much more precipitation. Additional heavy rain on this saturated soil could lead to flash flooding. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Montana, including the following areas, Carter, Custer, Fallon and Northern Rosebud. * WHEN...From 6 PM MDT this evening through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
